I so my role was as a communicator and I

current. Now, the Antarctic circumpolar
current is the most kind of ravenous
current in the world and it spins around
Antarctica. Um, and essentially it kind
of acts like a force field. So, it keeps
the warmer waters to the north out and
it keeps the cold water around
Antarctica in to make sure that the icy
continent stays frozen.
But what scientists have realized over
the past few years is that that current
is actually getting leaky.
And so um we went down there to
investigate, you know, why that actually
might be. Um the kind of consequence of
a leaky current is that Antarctica will
melt more quickly. And obviously um
that's a little bit of a problem given
that it plays a really key role in
reflecting a lot of the heat that's
coming um sort of into the into our
atmosphere and into the planet keeping
that heat away.
I I can't say that it was all, you know,

down it collects samples. And so, um, at
